text.p: Following are the main stories in Friday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- The Royal Malaysian Air Force investigates the possibility that the two helicopters which crashed in eastern Sabah state on Tuesday could have collided in mid-air.
-- Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad advises developing countries to verify with the respective Malaysian embassies before they seek the services of Malaysian companies.
-- Rescuers recover all 11 bodies of air force personnel in helicopter crash.

-- Youth wing of United Malays National Organisation urges Singapore Deputy Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong to apologise and remove offending paragraphs on Johor state from a court affidavit which had enraged Malaysia.
